intro: Pyrenaria mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao pyrenaria, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
